Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: cmpTX
Reviews.Content: OK for 1 night. Booked because of location; should have tried one of the others down the street. Brand new but nothing stellar.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: kandkwed
Reviews.Content: Everything was as expected from the hotel, except I have had better room service food at other hotels (it is important to note that the food was not horrible).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: megsmom4865
Reviews.Content: The hotel was renovated recently, so the room was almost brand new. The staff was very friendly and helped me with some sightseeing possibilites. Pool and jacuzzi were good, but we kept telling them no towels were out there. They were very prompt in getting more towels. The beds were really comfortable and if I can figure out how to get a shower like that, I am definately doing it!!!! Having a refrigerator and microwave was a big help.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Clean, Nice, Quiet.”
Reviews.Author: travelsNclass
Reviews.Content: Close to just about everything. Are isn't the nicest but it's safe. Hotel was clean as if it were a 5 star Hotel in Vegas. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing renovations! incredible rooms!”
Reviews.Author: KyHomebound
Reviews.Content: NOT RAMADA ANYMORE!!!!! NOW A BRAND NEW HOLIDAY INN PROPERTY I have stayed at this property for years, and have to say that out of all my stays, this one by far is the best. They finished the renovations(which I hear was in excess of 4 million dollars), and the room was fantastic - new beds, tv, bathroom, carpet, everything. The restaurant is now open again too, for breakfast lunch and dinner, and they serve room service again too. the rates have gone up a little, but the raise is worth it on so many levels. Thanks to Chris and his staff for going out of their way to make my return a great one. Clean rooms, wonderful staff, and just the feeling of being appreciated makes this my Phoenix home away from home for sure.. Check it out

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: Capric0rn1225
Reviews.Content: When I checked in , the male front desk clerk/manager was friendly; but the evening/night clerk was kind of "bitter" to be at work at night shift. We were assigned to the first floor room which although facing the front, it's backing off the pool. The problem started when some group of people were making so much noise and still partying at 2:00A.M, despite of pool "rules" of no swimming after !0:00P.M.! We have to complain 3X, before this lady clerk went and reprimand the group in the pool! The only "plus" in our stay was the hot full breakfast buffet. I would still go back and stay for the price, but never again in the same room/area close to the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!!”
Reviews.Author: Archuleta
Reviews.Content: When I booked the reservation for this hotel I was aware that it was under construction, but when I walked in I was astonished to see that the place looked like a dump! I understand that they needed to repair a few thing but they should not have been booking rooms with the hotel in that state. The price of the room was $69 and though the rooms looked fairly nice at first at 3 am we were woken up by the sound of banging and screaming in the room directly next to us. Our ghetto neighbors were banging furniture and screaming. The fight was frightening, so I reached for the phone to call the desk only to find that the phone did not work. I personally walked all the way to the desk to request that the hotel staff check on the occupants of the room next to us, they complied, moving us a few rooms down the hall. At that point we tried to salvage what was left of our night. In the morning we woke to find a very large dead cockroach right in front of our fridge and it looked like it had been their for some time. Finally we made it downstairs to enjoy the continental breakfast, which was set up in a with visible drywall and a sheet covering the rest of the construction area. The food was laid out on collapsable metal tables, and the tables in which we ate were surrounded by stain covered chairs. Needless to say we did not stay and eat there. After talking to the manager about our unpleasant stay he said that he could not control who was in the room next to us, he promised to called back and resolve the situation (which never happened) and offered us no refund. SO for all those who plan to stay in this Ramada beware!

Reviews.Title: “Used to be nice, under construction”
Reviews.Author: xeriscaping
Reviews.Content: I used to use this hotel a few years ago, It had been newly remodeled and made completely smoke-free. The deluxe rooms were very nice and they had a full hot breakfast buffet. The prices went up and the buffet went away. they do still have a breakfast with hot waffles, but that just makes them average. The last two times I stayed there, I was surprised how low the price was and found out only after showing up that it was totally under construction! nothing was said in the reservation process. The pool and spa were not available and what used to be the buffet, then turned into a restaurant was also not available. The breakfast they served was in a backroom at the end of the hall. The room was still nice, but a hotel is more than the room. I won't choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, Renovated”
Reviews.Author: DoDTraveler1
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights....my room was newly renovated, had a great clean smell to it, the bathroom door was a bit weird, poor design, but hey, Im not staying for the bathroom door!. The breakfast was terrible though! Im not sure that this is a Ramada Plaza, seems more like a Ramada Inn, there is a difference between the two. The staff was nice, check in was fast, location was convenient for me for Luke AFB. This is an upgraded Ramada with modern amenities, but it is a Ramada, its clean, safe and affordable! The area is over saturated with hotels and they are struggling with there fair share(clear by the very low low rates in the area). Fine hotel for a mutli -night stay, just ensure that you get a renovated room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: steveggflagstaff_AZ
Reviews.Content: I give this place a 5 star for excellent service and clean rooms! Good Job!

Reviews.Title: “We'll go back.”
Reviews.Author: me-pollyanna
Reviews.Content: First it is not at Metro Center - but in the Metro Center area. This is an old hotel - under renovation - but bend over backwards to make our stay enjoyable. We had a few problems with our suite - but were moved immediately to a better room - at no charge. . The manager - Chris was more than accomodating to our needs. I would stay there again - after renovations are complete. We were told that after renovations are complete the hotel will become a Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “I would rather sleep in my car”
Reviews.Author: beachgirl4434607
Reviews.Content: I was traveling to see my grandchildren , So i wanted a place that had a pool and breakfast . When i made the reservation I had looked online to view the rooms and swimming pool .It looked real nice .WELL after arriving i was shocked at how dirty the place was it was after midnight so i just thought well i will deal with this in the morning . I went to the front desk and told them that my room was filthy and could they move me to another room , the new room seemed ok , so i showered and left stopping by the front desk and asking them to please leave clean towels , since i was going to be put all day . when i returned with my grandchildren they had not left clean towels so we went to the front desk and asked for them we got them ok with a big attitude , the next morning we went to try this breakfast bar lol nasty looking food and very dirty area , we put our food in the trash went to our room packed up , stopped by the front desk again and told them how dirty it was and i explained that i own a motel in trasure island florida and could not believe how dirty the place was . I also informed the lady that the pictures they post online where not accurate at all .She informed me that they stage photos she said if you own a motel you know what i mean i was shocked she was like yeah the breakfast bar and all are staged , I told her no i didnt understand that and would never do such a thing . also not to mention the pool was green and had some sort of worm in it i was also told pool guys would not be there until the following week what a shocker .....DO NOT STAY THERE.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great staff, great time!!!”
Reviews.Author: KyHomebound
Reviews.Content: I have been to Phoenix many times over the past few years, and always have a good room at the Ramada. They have been through many changes in the last 2 years, from owners, all the way down to management. Although there have been a few hiccups along the way, I think this hotel will be a oasis in the desert. From what I heard from the desk staff, the hotel is going to be going through a major renovation and so it will be a rough few months till that is complete. The staff here is top notch, all friendly and cheerful, and they can get you to anywhere you want to go! Even the maintenance guy, Chris I think, made us laugh while he fixed the tv in our room. All in all, have had a great stay there and will continue to return each and everytime I visit Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “In need of a good cleaning”
Reviews.Author: ryanwest
Reviews.Content: I booked this room through a non-refundable web site at a great rate. The hotel is located in an area that is dying. Each staff member I met was polite and a pleasure to talk with. The Restaurant at the location is closed except for the Continental breakfast. The hallway carpets are filthy. My room showed signs of wear. The sheets were ripped, the blanket was worn and you could feel the springs in the bed. There was an old TV in the room and the faces on it were a bit orange. The ceiling tile in the bathroom had a large brown stain. The AC unit was noisey. Think twice before booking here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Kind of like a fake hotel.”
Reviews.Author: andreajob7
Reviews.Content: We pulled up and the hotel looks alright from the outside. The front desk lady was able to tell us the fastest way to get up to our room. We stopped by the pool to check it out before going up to the room but there was a sign that said it was closed. The hot tub was open but it was incredibly cloudy and green. We went up to our room and it was clean for the most part. It was outdated, though. I booked through Hotwire and got a good deal. However, Hotwire told me that this hotel had a fitness center and a restaurant attached to it. The booklet for this hotel also advertises a restaurant and a fitness center. There is something called "Sierra Grill and Bar" attached to the hotel but it is not a restaurant. It is where they set up the "hot breakfast" in the morning which consists of yogurt, waffles, and toast. I was really upset that there was no fitness center because I am on a week long trip and need my exercise. It just seemed like a lot was advertised and promised but nothing was delivered.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price with pool, hot tub, and free breakfast”
Reviews.Author: GMan5431
Reviews.Content: Got this place for $40+ tax on Priceline while in Phoenix area for Spring Training. Considering that the hotel was nice, the room was clean and had two nice beds, nice shower and frig and micro - had a pool and nice hot tub, and then a pretty good breakfast spread. Also there were restaraunts within walking distance and the staff was nice and helpful. Definately got my moneys worth at this place! G Man

Reviews.Title: “General Manager and Staff not avaliable to help STAY AWAY!"”
Reviews.Author: Plo69
Reviews.Content: BEWARE! My famly rented their conference/dinner room for a nominal fee. As we walked through the conference room we asked all the questions, or so we thought. We inquired if the table, chairs and "dance floor" would be set up prior to our guest arriving, or so we thought! As we where given the tour, the manager Steve, supported our request for table set up and also ensured the dance floor would be fixed and screwed together ( for obvious safety reasons). After our 1/2 down deposit, and a written contract and verbal hand shake we felt the room would be preped and ready to go. Long story short, the floor was never fixed, the tables and chairs where set up by the family. And the GM of this property was not avlb to take our calls, or send anyone to fix the floor. After a fall from an elderly guest we decided to call it a night with the dancing part of our party. Please note, this property will be changing it's name to Holiday Inn. I would not recommend this property and would not use floor 3 or 4. GM Steve and Customer Service Rep Sonya are rude, cheep and do not return calls. All in all the elderly woman completed a catscan and was released from the hospital.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: lantz4
Reviews.Content: While the carpets in the main hallways need to be replaced and the walls could use a fresh coat of paint I have to say we were very satisfied with our room. We found this hotel after a scarey experience at the Days Inn Airport (you can see that review as well by me). Our ultimate destination was Sedona, so as we were headed out of Phoenix we saw this Ramada and decided to try it. Boy were we happy we did! The staff at the desk was very helpful and friendly for both check-in and check-out. The room itself was fantastic-everything is remodeled and updated. Very clean (and I'm a freak about cleanliness!) The beds were very comfortable. The towels were great-nice and fluffy and soft. The breakfast was pretty decent as well. All in all a very welcome place after a scarey start for my first time in Phoenix. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fair value, nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: daiseero
Reviews.Content: The exterior of the hotel, the hallways, and the lobby left something to be desired. Very typical Ramada-esque decor. The outdoor pool didn't look like something I wanted to venture into...left my swimsuit packed for my entire stay. The room itself was very nicely furnished. Everything looked new, updated, and worked. The fridge and microwave were very handy since I had a 5 night stay. Really liked the free in-room WiFi service. The traffic was a little loud, but not ridiculous, especially considering how close it is to the interstate. All in all I think for the price I paid, I'm a happy customer.

Reviews.Title: “There are better hotels - look elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: 99dakota4by4
Reviews.Content: Check-in was nice enough and the room (updated) was pleasant enough. However, the walls are paper thin and when you have load neighbors it doesn't matter how nice the room is. Had to call the front desk to complain about the TV volume next door at. It was left one ALL NIGHT where it could be heard well both in our room and out in the hall. The hotel did NOTHING! Also, the wireless service they have is limited. Yes, it's nice to have a wireless connection, but when the service provider they've chosen only allows a certain number of clients to be signed on at any one time, well that's not a good service for a large hotel. We were not able to sign on 75% of the time in the evenings. Had to wait until early morning before we were able to get signed in. The front desk is no help here. I as well as others went/called the front desk only to be told they can do nothing and to call this 1-800 number. They do have a 'business center' with internet connectivity, but you have to pay for the service. Come on, how many people actually pay extra for that. Lastly, the breakfast was lacking. I'm not a big breakfast eater, but the only fruit were apples and the juices were thin and watery. Come on Ramada, step up or I'll not return.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but shop around”
Reviews.Author: ElPasoTexan
Reviews.Content: PROS: The Ramada is centrally located so that everything from outlets, the zoo, night life, and restaurants are accessible. At $62 per night, the Ramada is cheap but a bit pricier than its competitors, so shop around before you commit. The amenities such as free wifi, breakfast (standard continental) fitness room, and pool are rated B+. CONS: The rooms seem are outdated: the television would go off and on, the furniture needs to be replaced, and the bathrooms need a pick-me-up!!!. Not to mention the surrounding area: our view of a vacant FOOD CITY was horrible; it seemed to be the poor side of Phoenix. .

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SamuelC3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is spacious and very comfortable. I interviewed several applicants in my room, and the service was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DocHollywoodTexas
Reviews.Content: Easily the worst and dirtiest hotel I have ever stayed at. Lights without light bulbs, requested a crib way in advance then housekeeping supervisor could not find (was supposedly lost in one of the rooms) so they offered to put blankets on the floor for our 15 month old to sleep on?!?!?!?! The bathroom was dirty, toilet actually had remnants of someone else's BOWEL MOVEMENT!!! I will never nor would I ever recommend anyone to ever stay at any Ramada property!!!! You get what you pay for and they are awful!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: benlosangeles
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the hotel for one night and was very pleased with my room. It was modern with a Doubletree look to it.. My room was on the first floor(138) and looked like it was just renoveted. The lobby is a bit outdated but overall It was a pleasent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LizyAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: There is really nothing negative to tell about this hotel. The rooms are very clean, the pool is very nice, clean and quiet. Great value for your money! Best hotel I ever stayed in while visiting the US!

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: Bridgenut3348
Reviews.Content: The first room they gave me smelled of smoke. The second one was better, but lots of dirt behind and under furniture. We had trouble to find a working outlet for our laptop. The furniture was from the 50s and ratty. Mattress was okay. Worst of all, I booked a room with breakfast included and the restaurant was closed. I was attending a tournament in downtown Phoenix and had to allot extra time to go to a restaurant before I could begin my day. Better to stay at Motel 6! Peter Wearing, Director of Operations, stated they were in financial trouble and couldn't afford to open the restaurant. No adjustments were made to the rate. I booked months ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value For the Money”
Reviews.Author: gregmuenz
Reviews.Content: I booked the room for 4 nights from Orbitz as room/ rental car package it was amazingly inexpensive. We were playing in a softball tournament on Saturday and Sunday and the fields were right across I-17 also with numerous eating options all close by I considered the location very convenient. I was a little bit nervous due to some of the reviews on here and considering this was my 7 th trip to phoenix for softball and I had always stayed at the Hilton Suites downtown I was a little bit leery. We arrived at the hotel at 11:00 am and surprisingly our room was ready and we were able to check in. One thing I did not like is that even with this being a pre-paid booking I was required to put a $35.00 per night deposit for incidentals on my credit card. Other then that the check-in was fine, We were booked into one of the renovated Deluxe rooms which was clean with comfortable beds, mini fridge and microwave. The wireless internet worked fine in the room and the AC kept everything cool. The bathroom had a sliding door that I felt did not give enough privacy if traveling with another person who is not your significant other. Our door got jammed but was promptly fixed after alerting the front desk. Did not have any noise issues with neighbors and overall it was pretty quite and I would say by the looks of the parking lot in the evenings the place was about 80% full. The breakfast buffet was okay at best, I will agree not very healthy options and after the second day I was sick of eggs, waffles, hash browns and sausage. Overall I found it a great value for the money, the staff I dealt with were courteous and efficient, and the place was clean and maintained to a rather high level for the age of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Isabella1966
Reviews.Content: We had stayed 4 nights, the location was great near the freeway, many restaurants, shops and the shopping center is about one miles away. The breakfast was not so great, the coffee was not strong enough the one in the room was much better. The room was clean and really nice we did book the standard room but were upgraded without additional cost. the a superior room, very spacious. We had difficulties with the internet connection the technical support was not a big help but a young lady at the reception helped us with the connection. The staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “I find it to be a good value.”
Reviews.Author: CCcoach
Reviews.Content: This is the second year that I have stayed at the Ramada Plaza Hotel at Metro Center while I attended spring training baseball games. Unlike some of the recent reviews, I have enjoyed my stay. The motel's location near the Black Canyon Highway (17) makes getting around Phoenix fairly easy, considering Phoenix traffic. At the same time, I did not notice excessive highway noise while I stayed at the motel. A runner, I found that the motel's location near the spillway system and the trails that border it a real plus. This year I stayed in one of the deluxe king rooms and was very pleased. The room was updated, neat, clean, and fairly roomy. The bathroom was modern, clean, and relatively large. The pool area is pleasant allowing one to sit outside, enjoy the warmth, and use the free wi fi. A real plus for me is the friendly, courteous, professional staff. Whether it was the day or evening staff, I found someone behind the desk who was patient and helpful. When I go down for spring training next March, I plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “please look some where else this place sucked!!!”
Reviews.Author: nilsSt_paul
Reviews.Content: im not a picky person and im not going to bad mouth it because of one little thing, in general the place was bad. it was in a bad area in a old building. the pool was full of junk and it smelled. it had supposedly been remodeled and we stayed in one of the remodeled rooms. tthe beds were uncomfortable and the furniture was already falling apart, to top it off the wireless wasnt capable of handling as many users as it was so it constantly crashed, id save your money and check out some where else. if you decide to stay here at least stay in a suite or remodeled room the old rooms are disgusting so much so we switched to a suite.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for....”
Reviews.Author: cootdawg
Reviews.Content: We attended the Del sol soccer tournament and we stayed in this hotel. The staff was pleasant enough, but the facilities left much to be desired. We were on the 3rd floor so it was not one of the renovated rooms. The walls are thin, and you could hear your neighbors and the traffic outside. Our toilet also clogged during our 2 day stay, although totally annoying, (not to mention embarrassing!) The front desk sent someone up to fix it within 5 minutes of calling. The cost of the room included a daily breakfast which was honestly inedible. Over all in wasn't a horrible experience, but I wouldn't stay there again. I would like to emphasize that I found the staff very pleasant, just the facilities were inadequate.

Reviews.Title: “A Bit Frightening”
Reviews.Author: YimpTraveller
Reviews.Content: As previous posters have mentioned, the photographs are deceptive- the typical rooms are old and worn. The remodeled rooms were alright, although it had no bathtub (European-style, though I doubt that is Ramada's intent). I was very disappointed with the breakfast. Though there was a variety, it was all fairly unhealthy. Fatty meats, canned fruit in heavy syrup, rather than fresh fruit, no whole grain breads, no yogurt or skim milk, as many other hotel chains offer. Probably would not stay there again, though the price was good.

Reviews.Title: “Ramada Plaza Phonix”
Reviews.Author: sdsalor
Reviews.Content: We stayed fri and sat night in early Dec. We were given an "upgrade" because we had prepaid for the room. The room was on the first floor and overlooked the pool. It was clean and neat they have been upgraded lately. The TV was Bad I havent see that bad a picture in a long time. There was some hallway noise in the evenings. The breakfast was good for me however My Wife has some diet restrictions and could not take advantage of the full buffet. The food did not stay hot very long. Location was fine very easy access.Many restaurants close by. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff. Food was good. Some remoding is needed. Would return.”
Reviews.Content: Clean room. Great staff. Nice breakfast. I wish it had a tub. Some remodeling is needed, and was underway in some rooms. Nice stay for the room rate. We were there for ten days. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate accomodations, free breakfast an added plus”
Reviews.Author: sand4c
Reviews.Content: I think my hotel room was in serious need of remodeling. It didn't look anything like the rooms in the pictures I saw on online travel websites. It was quite old, the television barely worked (too many lines), paint was chipping and cracking on the bathroom door. I think the $1 access charge they have for all calls including 800-number calls is a rip-off. Thankfully, I had a cell phone which I used exclusively. On the plus side: their wi-fi wireless internet access was great, there was plenty of free parking, the hotel was right next to a 7-11 gas station/store as well as a Chevron and other establishments. The deluxe breakfast was quite nice. I stayed at a Howard Johnson motel that gave packaged goods and terrible juice as "complimentary continental breakfast," but this hotel made a more serious effort. There were scrambled eggs, sausage or bacon (varied each day), hash browns, cereal, milk, mixed fruit salad, canned peaches, croissants, sliced bread, jam, cream cheese, bagels, and muffins. Definitely a nice variety.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but....”
Reviews.Author: kah222
Reviews.Content: The room was great... very nice and clean. There was only a shower... no tub. The pool was nice. The "temporary" fitness center was 2 treadmills and bike... of which none worked. I asked to have a manager call me (left him a message) but he never called me back.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: NVAZCA
Reviews.Content: I am staying at the hotel soon and I am not treated well through email. This Hotel has a very rude Front Office Manager. I am asking them about PC rental or use of a computer. The business center costs $5 for 10 minutes. I snapped back telling him how much Days Inn offers it to their guests (free of charge to guests) And I told him I'd rather stay there. I also saw the review about this hotel and I told him I am reconsidering if I really want to stay there. Then he snaps back at me telling me that he gets other travelers (business and leisure) and that its, basically, in my words, "okay" If I don't stay here. Also they don't own the business center. I am now furious even to think about staying here after seeing the horrible reviews, and I'm hoping the management sees this and knows how a customer is being treated. I hope other people see this who are thinking about traveling to Phoenix to stay here, not to, so that they understand what a customer, who could be valuable to them. I hope they see that im spreading the word about the treatment, which i will say was not the best ever, to their "business and leisure" customers so they know that I am not going to be treated badly, and that this person should be fired and/or punished for not giving the treatment a person deserves if they are trying to get a simple deal/bargain or more value of their stay. Apparently there is something called the Pinnacle Award that is presented to the two best Ramada properties. I hope this hotel doesn't even get close to even getting thought about getting this award. There is also a President Award for the hotel that offers outstanding guest service and exceptional product quality. Not even close. As I will be staying here soon, I'll add in my update of what i think about this poor service of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: lakeflyer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel Memorial Day weekend 2008. We selected the hotel based on price and the central location. We drove up to the hotel in a torrential downpour. Thank goodness for the covered portico. When we first checked in, we were given a room on the first floor at the very end of the hallway. The room was in the renovated section of the hotel. The bathroom was really modern and fresh. The bed was comfortable and felt clean. We had a refrigerator and small microwave. It was a really nice room, until the air conditioning unit broke at midnight. Since it is Phoenix and hot, it got really uncomfortable quickly in the room. We called the front desk but there were no more king rooms left for us to move into. We didn't mind moving to a double for the night, as long as they could move us into another king the next day. I think to make it up to us, they offered to move us into the suite on the fourth floor. It sounded great, but we had no idea that the room was nothing like the one we were leaving. The suite on the fourth floor was, to put it mildly, a huge dump and slightly scary to boot. The two rooms were not renovated since 1970. The carpet was horribly stained. I didn't want to walk on it in my bare feet. The bed sagged and the air conditioning kicked on and off for no reason. The dropped ceiling tiles were stained and a few were actually hanging off onto the armoire. I was extremely uncomfortable in the room and had a terrible nightmare in that bed. I refused to stay another night in there. My husband was not exactly pleased with having to switch rooms yet again, but the next morning after breakfast, I requested that we get switched to another king room, preferably on the first floor, since that was the only floor with the renovated rooms. We got another renovated room and actually enjoyed the rest of our time there. The breakfast was the same every morning - eggs, sausage, pastries and cereal. I didn't think it was all that fresh or that good, so we only went twice during our stay and skipped it the rest of the time. The small pool was packed with kids and so we opted not to fight the rugrats for a spot that wasn't getting splashed. The location is pretty close to the Metro Center and we were able to navigate around Phoenix pretty easily from there. The location did seem a bit sketchy but it is a freeway hotel. I don't think we would stay there again, especially if we can afford Scottsdale the next time. The renovated rooms are really nice but I wouldn't want to take the chance of getting one of the non-renovated rooms. And don't take them up on the offer to be moved to the fourth floor suite. That room should be taken out of service until it is renovated. It's absolutely horrible...

Reviews.Title: “Hated It!!!!”
Reviews.Author: e-14
Reviews.Content: From beginning to end, this hotel was a NIGHTMARE. VERY rude staff who treated my wife and I like 2nd-class citizens because we booked our room on hotwire.com. They did not honor our bed type request, but held the requests for guests who had not checked yet. The staff would not let us speak to the manager about problems, and were very combative. The exterior and interior of this hotel are old and run-down. We do not normally complain much, and it takes A LOT for us to do so. This was the WORST hotel experience we have ever been a part of. DO NOT STAY HERE!!! When we called Ramada's toll-free customer service number, the representative was very rude and combative. She started arguing with me about Hotwire's rules and regulations, but I was quick to point out that she works for Ramada, not Hotwire. She did not apologize once. WE WILL NEVER STAY AT A RAMADA HOTEL AGAIN BECAUSE OF THIS EXPERIENCE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Stay of 3 hotels in Arizona”
Reviews.Author: jengoat
Reviews.Content: We began our 10 day stay at the Ramada and kicked our vacation off to a great start. We arrived after midnite and had no problem checking in. The room was very clean and newly renovated. The beds were extremely comfortable-sleeping until 9:00am and not disturbed by any noise. Breakfast was outstanding for a hotel buffet (eggs, sausage, bagels, fruit, etc.) We ended our trip by staying back at the same hotel and found the convenience of its location and distance to the airport wonderful. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not for me”
Reviews.Author: Mpeas
Reviews.Content: My wife's family has had other great stays with hotels in this chain, and we thought this would be a good place to stay overnight in Phoenix. The complex appears quite modern and clean. That is the best I can say for it. The reception counter is 24hr and we got in around 9pm. The girl behind the desk clearly wanted to be elsewhere, and a guy ahead of us was trying to get the hair dryer in his room repaired, which he had reported 2 days previously. As soon as he left, the staff member gave the maintenance department a completely different room number. I guess that way she can inconvenience even more people. This should have been warning enough. The hotel has excessive charges for everything you may want to use there. Internet charges were outrageous, and the laundry needed $7 to wash and almost dry just one load of laundry. The pool looked nice, although we didn't use it. The A/C was extremely noisy. If I'm ever in Phoenix again I will be choosing another hotel. I doubt very much whether I would stay in a Ramada room again by choice, based on this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Night Sleep & Good Value”
Reviews.Author: ehedman
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times in the last few months on business trips. I have been treated well, the breakfast is good, the bar has a nicely priced happy hour, and the rooms are clean and comfortable. It is very conveniently located and I seem to be within driving distance of anything I need. I have not stayed here with my family, but I think it would be fun. The only drawbacks are: the renovation that is ongoing in some parts of the hotel. (But I have not been inconvenienced by the renovations in any way, it is just unsightly.) and the wireless internet in the rooms kick me off every 3-4 minutes. The free hot breakfast is certainly a plus when travelling. The business center is very nice, convenient, and well kept. I held several interviews in there. The staff always seems pleasant. Have a good night, EH Cypress, CA.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: copaholic
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in mid october of 07. The first room i was put in was a standard room however i knew there was some remodeling done so i asked the front desk if i would be able to switch to one of those rooms. It was an extra 20 bucks a day but it was worth it. A very modern floor plan and styling wtih a fridge and microwave. The pool was in good condition and it was in good proximity to I17. The comp. breakfast buffet wasent bad at all although i only had it once when i was there. All in all it was nice but i would deffinitly upgrade to the new remodeled rooms.

Reviews.Title: “not so great customer service”
Reviews.Author: slhouston
Reviews.Content: When I arrived, the computers were down so I sat and waited in the lobby with my luggage while the two women at the desk were surfing the internet. After over an hour, I asked if they were sure they couldn't check me in by hand. One woman said she could, so I got let into a room. I was in bed falling asleep when she called my room and told me that she had put me in the wrong room and I had to move now. I told her that I was in bed and she threatened to move me to a smaller room if I didn't cooperate. She barely gave me enough time to pack before she was at my door telling me to move. I was frustrated that she treated me like that, but the rest of the hotel was fine. I still probably wouldn't stay at that hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A return visit”
Reviews.Author: jb012
Reviews.Content: I've just paid a return visit a couple of weeks ago, a year after my last trip to Phoenix. There are still signs of renovation work ongoing (those massive containers in the back parking lot are still there). I was offered the choice of floors and, like the last reviewer, I had one of the renovated rooms. They are a cut above the average Ramada. As I've said before, this place is good value for the money I paid ($64 a night). It's conveniently located off I-17 and the MetroCenter and restaurants are a 5-10 minute drive away. Even the drive to Chase Field to watch the D'backs play took only 20 minutes. My impression of this Ramada has improved since the last time I stayed here a year ago. If I ever have to return to Phoenix, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to eat breakfast and sleep”
Reviews.Author: Musictraveller
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Phoenix last year to watch spring training baseball. I was there primarily for the Brewers, and this hotel was one of the closer ones to Maryvale park and the freeway. We didn't spend much time at our hotel. It's not fancy, and they seemed to be doing some "renovations". That said, the full breakfast buffet (waffles!), location and outdoor hottub were enough for me to stay there again this upcoming March. Yes, you get what you pay for, and there's not a lot within a 5 minute drive (or walk) but like anywhere else in Phoenix, there's lots within a 10-15 minute drive. Including an awesome Mexican restaurant that I can't remember the name or location for the life of me. I'll find it though!

Reviews.Title: “Tolerable, but unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: Newtonian2
Reviews.Content: Lured by an AAA bargain rate that (surprise, surprise) wasn't available, my wife and I stayed here in early March 2006. As others have reported, at that time there were signs up announcing "rennovations" but these seem to be a more or less permanent part of the decor (they'd been up since the previous winter). While the rooms were clean, if spartan, the halls were dingy and the hotel fairly unpleasant and not much of a bargain. It's located in a vast wasteland of shopping centers (the "MetroCenter" turns out to be a shopping center that looks like every other shopping center in the country) and abandoned shopping centers that have turned into mega-churches. It's a fairly long ride to the airport, especially in Phoenix traffic, which is dreadful. There's a small pool with what I guess was water in it -- but I wouldn't risk swimming there! The staff was generally clueless -- one spent most of his time hitting a computer keyboard as hard as he could, complaining about the keys not working and had no idea how to get to the Frank Lloyd Wright house (though the advertisement for the hotel lists it as "nearby" -- it turns out it is on the other side of town). The rest of the desk staff seemed unaccustomed to dealing with people and looked confused when we asked them questions. The hotel seems to book large groups (a university baseball team was checking out the same morning we were leaving) and, in general, the hotel gives the impression that its guests as potential troublemakers (perhaps a sensible guess if it is booking that many large groups!). So the rooms have lots of notices advising you not to steal things -- though I'm not sure what you'd want to steal -- and there is a staff member placed at the breakfast room to make sure you don't come back and eat two breakfasts -- though, again, given the rather dreary assortment of high-fat, high-sugar items available, I'm not sure who would try to sneak back. There's got to be a better place to stay in Phoenix for the price.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn North Phoenix
HotelInfo.Address: 12027 North 28th Drive, Phoenix, AZ 85029 (Formerly Ramada Plaza Hotel at Metro Center)
